page.title: 05A BROWNHILLS FUND RAISER.
page.content: Adrian Wigley of Brownhills has an unusual way of raising money for charity. He plays the organ with his nose and tongue. He noticed that it had never been done before and so he gave it a try, first of all using his nose. Following this success he then learned to play the organ using his tongue. His work has received public recognition. He appeared on BBC Television on 1st March 1984, and in 1986 his achievement of playing the organ six hours with his nose and two hours with his tongue will be included in the Guinness Book of Records. He has raised money for many charities and this year the proceeds will be given to the Childrens' Hospital in Birmingham. He hopes shortly to play the organ with his elbow.
